====== DESCRIPTION ======

Animals
September 20‚Äì October 20, 2019

The varied aesthetic uses of animals has often been captured through visual art, both subjects of study themselves and as reflections of humanity. Site:Brooklyn wants to give artists an opportunity to show works, across subject matter, medium, form, that focus on the interplay between animals and art. You might focus on, but are by no means limited to, personal connections with animals, the use of animal materials in art, how animals represent social, political, and aesthetic ideas, and how artists use animals in imaginative or formally innovative ways.

ABOUT THE JUROR:
Alina Cohen is a staff writer at Artsy. She has written on a freelance basis for The
New York Times, Vanity Fair, Art in America, New York Magazine, Hyperallergic,
and a number of other publications. She previously worked at Nadine Johnson,
The Pulitzer Arts Foundation, and the Contemporary Art Museum St.
Louis.

ABOUT THE GALLERY:
Site:Brooklyn Gallery located in Brooklyn, New York is dedicated to exhibiting the current practice of contemporary artists.

DATES:
Call Announcement: May 20, 2019
Final Submission Deadline: July 15, 2019 11:59 PM MT
Notification Letter: July 23, 2019
Gallery Exhibition: September 20‚Äì October 20, 2019
Opening Reception: Friday, September 20, 2019 from 6-9 PM

ELIGIBILITY:
This is a juried exhibition for artists working in drawing, painting, printmaking, sculpture, collage.
This exhibition is open to all artists 18 years of age or older.

SUBMISSIONS AND FEES:
Only original works may be submitted. The fee is $35.00 for up to three (3) images, $10 for each additional image. If adding additional images please do so prior to check out.
All entries must be registered/received by July 15, 2019 11:59 PM MT
All entry fees are non-refundable.

DIRECTIONS FOR ONLINE SUBMISSION: https://bit.ly

PRESENTATION:
1. Maximum Size: 60‚Äù X 60‚Äù X 24‚Äù D
2. All artwork must be suitably framed to a professional standard. All framed work must use Plexiglas, except hand-delivered work less than 24‚Äù x 30‚Äù. Wall mounted sculpture, canvas and wood panels do not require a frame. No clip frames, saw-tooth hangers or taped edges are permitted. Video work must include all equipment.
3. Work must be wired or have a cleat attachment and be ready for hanging. A label must be affixed to the back of the work that indicates which end is the top and includes the following: Artist Name, Title, Medium, Dimensions, and Price. This information must correspond with the Accepted image as listed on Notification form. No artwork may be substituted.
4. Work cannot be withdrawn, nor sales shipped, before the end of the exhibit.

SHIPPING:
Artists will be responsible for delivery and return shipping of all their artwork. The artist assumes all responsibility for insuring artwork against shipping damage or loss.

LIABILITY:
Site:Brooklyn is not responsible for any damage, breakage, replacement or cost associated with any damage or breakage that may have occurred during transport or unpacking the work. Every precaution will be taken in handling the work, but Site:Brooklyn assumes no liability for any loss or damage to any artist‚Äôs work while in our care, custody or control, before, during or after the exhibition. Each artist, if they wish, needs to provide their own insurance.

SALES/COMMISSIONS:
All artwork must be priced for sale.
Artwork cannot be withdrawn, nor sales shipped, before the end of the exhibit.
Site:Brooklyn will retain a 50% commission on all exhibition sales. The price represented on the artist entry form will be the sale price. No changes will be allowed.

CONTACT/QUESTIONS:
Please direct all questions to sitebrooklyn@sitebrooklyn.com

ENTRY AGREEMENT:
With the submission of artwork into the ‚ÄúAnimals‚Äù Exhibition, the artist agrees to all the terms and conditions set forth in this prospectus.

MOXI (The Wolf Museum of Exploration and Innovation) opened in 2017 and was listed by Fodor's Travel as one of the top 10 new museums in the world. Based in Santa Barbara, CA, MOXI has two spaces dedicated to rotating 3-month interactive media art installations. This call represents MOXI's second open application for artists and art collectives to propose works, for the year 2020. Artworks should be interactive and designed to be highly robust to accommodate active children and family visitors. Total budget of a large-scale interactive artwork can be up to $10,000. ====== DESCRIPTION ======

Our Spring Pop-up Exhibition HEIRLOOM:

Ground Floor Gallery is pleased to announce our spring open call for "HEIRLOOM," a pop-up show in honor of the season and the significance of family! As defined by Merriam-Webster Dictionary, an heirloom is:

1: a piece of property (such as a deed or charter) that descends to the heir as an inseparable part of an inheritance of real property
2: something of special value handed down from one generation to another
3: a variety of plant that has originated under cultivation and that has survived for several generations usually due to the efforts of private individuals.

In true Ground Floor Gallery fashion, "HEIRLOOM" is an extension of our mission to connect emerging artists to new art buyers while - in our small way - supporting a cause we deem urgent. Each original artwork will be sold for $225; all sales will be accompanied by a certificate of authenticity; and, in honor of election year and the prospect of new beginnings - $20.20 from each sale will benefit RAICES: (The Refugee and Immigrant Center for Education and Legal Services) in their continued efforts to reunite immigrant families separated at the border.

Submission Deadline EXTENDED: Sunday, June 9th, 2019, 12pm. No fee to enter.

SAVE THE (NEW!) DATE for the Opening Reception: Wednesday, June 12th, 5-9pm

Two years ago, you all helped us raise over $1,000 for the Committee to Protect Journalists and we‚Äôre hoping your passion and sense of urgency to address this most pressing of issues resonates as strongly!
